amendment.purpose: An amendment, offered as a substitute to the Markey amendment and printed in House Report 104-223 as amendment No. 2-6, to encourage the television and video industry to establish industry-wide technology standards and rating procedures which would empower parents to block programming they deem inappropriate for their children; and requires the GAO to sumit to Congress a report evaluating the availability and effectiveness of such technologies, standards, and procedures.

action.text: Substitute (A008) offered by Mr. Coburn to the Markey amendment (A007).

vote.text: On agreeing to the Coburn amendment (A008) Agreed to by recorded vote: 222 - 201 (Roll no. 633).
